revision.text: {{ArticleHistory|action1=GAN |action1date=10:28, 20 August 2011 |action1link=Talk:If Day/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=442989366 |action2=PR |action2date=10:29, 9 September 2011 |action2link=Wikipedia:Peer review/If Day/archive1 |action2result=reviewed |action2oldid=448874729 |action3=WAR |action3date=04:30, 29 September 2011 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/If Day |action3result=approved |action3oldid=452437557 |action4=FAC |action4date=03:10, 13 October 2011 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/If Day/archive1 |action4result=promoted |action4oldid=455258663 |dykdate=4 August 2011 |dykentry=... that the only known report of bloodshed during the simulated '''[[If Day|Nazi invasion of Winnipeg]]''' was from a woman who cut her thumb while preparing toast? |topic=war |currentstatus=FA |maindate=May 1, 2013 |four=no }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Canada|class=FA|importance=Low|history=yes|mb=yes}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA |A-Class=pass| |Canadian-task-force=yes |WWII-task-force=yes }} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2012-02-19|oldid1=477716649}} ==Note about article creation== I've lived in Winnipeg my whole life and had never heard about this event until I saw it mentioned in passing on a TV show. I could only find one article of any substance on If Day, so I tried to distill some of the main points and make a quick wikipedia page about it. [[User:Don Dueck|Don Dueck]] ([[User talk:Don Dueck|talk]]) 19:59, 18 February 2009 (UTC) == Has this been TFA?== Because, if it has not, it would seem to go well on April Fool's day. It could be easily be made to be misleading, but it would be honestly factual. But it's all just my opinion.[[Special:Contributions/76.95.96.150|76.95.96.150]] ([[User talk:76.95.96.150|talk]]) 03:04, 15 November 2011 (UTC) :No, it hasn't been TFA, and that's not a bad idea. [[User:Nikkimaria|Nikkimaria]] ([[User talk:Nikkimaria|talk]]) 13:50, 15 November 2011 (UTC) == Footage? == Is there any recording of the day that could be linked to? Might be of interest. Surv1v4l1st ([[User_talk:Surv1v4l1st|Talk]]|[[Special:Contributions/Surv1v4l1st|Contribs]]) 03:02, 20 September 2009 (UTC) {{Talk:If Day/GA1}} == Good to know... == Funny that after World War II there was a town that had a similar exercise over what would happen if the communists had taken over, and that incident gets laughed at by dismissers of the communist threat. ---------[[User:DanTD]] ([[User talk:DanTD|talk]]) 02:11, 18 January 2016 (UTC)
